description: Hierarchical containment relationship for statutory structures (Statute→Section, Section→SubSection, SubSection→Clause)

variants.description: A section contains a sub-section (Iteration 3 enhancement)
A sub-section contains a clause (Iteration 3 enhancement)

indexes: CREATE INDEX contains_order IF NOT EXISTS FOR ()-[r:CONTAINS]-() ON (r.order)
CREATE INDEX contains_sequence IF NOT EXISTS FOR ()-[r:CONTAINS]-() ON (r.sequence_number)
CREATE INDEX contains_hierarchy IF NOT EXISTS FOR ()-[r:CONTAINS]-() ON (r.hierarchy_level)
usage_examples:
// Statute to Section
MATCH (s:Statute {statute_id: 'bd_pc'})-[c:CONTAINS]->(sec:Section)
RETURN sec.section_number, c.order
ORDER BY c.order

// Section to SubSection (new in Iteration 3)
MATCH (sec:Section {section_id: 'section_bd_pc_302'})-[c:CONTAINS]->(ss:SubSection)
RETURN ss.subsection_number, c.sequence_number
ORDER BY c.sequence_number

// SubSection to Clause (new in Iteration 3)
MATCH (ss:SubSection)-[c:CONTAINS]->(cl:Clause)
WHERE ss.subsection_id = 'subsection_bd_pc_302_1'
RETURN cl.clause_number, cl.text
ORDER BY c.sequence_number
